page.title: 02SCAWSBY TODAY
page.content: {Scawsby}(popn.6900) is a residential area,the northern part of which is covered by these notes.It is mainly family housing built in the 1930's but there are also some elderly citizen's bungalows and flats, and several general shops.The area is situated in the V formed by the junction of two major roads and has good public transport.There are three schools,for children from 5-8, 8-12 and 12-16. Passing through the centre of the community is part of the{Roman Ridge. This is used as a general pathway by the residents but is the original line of the Doncaster to Castleford Roman road. The part of Scawsby to the north of the Ridge is known as Sunnyfields. Most of the houses here have flat roofs and the area is known as "the flat tops".
